title: After I received a notice to enter default I was told FAM031 is required. Now I am asked to attend a Default Prove Up Trial.
question: I filed for a Dissolution of Marriage in 4/17/2014. The respondent, my wife, did not respond so I filed to enter default. After waiting over 6 months I receive a rejection letter from the court saying that Form FAM031 is required. I turned the FAM031 in December and just received a letter from the court asking to attend a "Notice of Default Set For Trial."
question_tags: Divorce,Do-it-yourself divorce,Dissolution of marriage,Dividing debts in a divorce,Community property in divorce,Divorce court,Divorce by default judgment,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Family law,Representing yourself,Default judgment
answers: The court just probably wants to confirm and clarify what you have put in your papers. Perhaps you left something out and rather than make you file again they'll handle it all at the hearing. In general, what the court needs to be sure of is that your spouse was properly served and that there has truly been no activity on her part. Then, if you asked for anything with regard to debts or property the court may want to go over that with you and make sure that what you are asking for now in the default is no greater than what you asked for in the Petition. It will not likely be complicated or stressful. Just be sure you have your information and how she was served and by whom clear and you should be fine.
The need for a hearing is optional with the judge. With the facts as you state them you should not have much trouble.

Most judges are very helpful when you are a self represented litigant. The judge should not be concerned with the reason for the marriage or the reason for the dissolution of the marriage. The judge will be more interested in the property issues even though you indicate there is no community property. If you are uncomfortable representing yourself you should hire an attorney to represent you at this hearing. You can locate an attorney through the find an attorney selection on AVVO.
